title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(test) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
title: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
text: Create APA-formatted text results independent-samples t-test following format: paired-samples t-test conducted compare {dv} {level1} (M = {mean1}, SD = {sd1}) {level2} (M = {mean2}, SD = {sd2}). {non}significant difference; t({df}) = {t_value}, p = {p_value}.

title: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
code: apa_t_pair(x, y, dv = "the DV", level1 = "level 1", level2 = "level 2")

title: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
text: x vector values level 1. y vector values level 2. dv text describing DV output statement. level1 text describing level 1 output statement. level2 text describing level 2 output statement.

title: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
code: # use generic text apa_t_pair(x = self_res_att$f_self,            y = self_res_att$f_non) #> A paired-samples t-test was conducted to compare the DV between level 1 (M = 3.5, SD = 1.6) and level 2 (M = 3.0, SD = 1.2). There was a significant difference; t(107) = 3.60, p = 0.000.  # specify the text for dv and levels apa_t_pair(x = self_res_att$f_self,            y = self_res_att$f_non,            dv = "preferences for female faces",            level1 = "participants who resembled those faces",            level2 = "non-self participants") #> A paired-samples t-test was conducted to compare preferences for female faces between participants who resembled those faces (M = 3.5, SD = 1.6) and non-self participants (M = 3.0, SD = 1.2). There was a significant difference; t(107) = 3.60, p = 0.000.

title: Distribution Class — new_dist
code: new_dist(   name = NULL,   type = c("continous", "discrete"),   ddist = NULL,   supp = NA,   cdist = NULL,   qdist = NULL,   hdist = NULL,   ...,   class = character() )

title: Distribution Class — new_dist
text: name name. type "continous" "discrete". ddist density function. cdist cdf. hdist hazard function. support support.

title: Distribution Class — new_dist
code: normal_density <- function(x, par1 = 0, par2 = 1) { dnorm(x, mean = par1, sd = par2) } normal_cdf <- function(x, par1 = 0, par2 = 1) { pnorm(x, mean = par1, sd = par2) } normal_hazard <- function(x, par1 = 0, par2 = 1) { normal_density(x, par1, par2) / ( 1 - normal_cdf(x, par1, par2) ) } x <- new_dist(name = "my.normal",  type = "continous", ddist = normal_density, supp = c(-Inf,Inf), cdist = normal_cdf, hdist = normal_hazard) print(x) #> [1] "my.normal is a continous distribution defined from -Inf to Inf."  y <- new_dist(ddist=dexp, type="continous", name="exponential", supp=c(0,Inf)) plot(y,type="b",pch=16) #> Error in x$qdist(0.001): attempt to apply non-function  z <- new_dist() plot(y+z,type="l",col=2) #> Error in uniroot((function(x) f(x) - y), lower = lower, upper = upper): f() values at end points not of opposite sign save(x,y,z, file="data/dist.rda") #> Warning: cannot open compressed file 'data/dist.rda', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in gzfile(file, "wb"): cannot open the connection

title: Route Clustering — rhclust
text: Route hclust function, see essay details. OOP.

title: Route Clustering — rhclust
text: pdist name. ptime "continous" "discrete". weight density function. data support.

title: Route Clustering — rhclust
code: system.time(temp <- rhclust(pdis, ptim, 0, data=rdata)) #> Error in data.table(path = path, et = c(0), lt = c(0)): could not find function "data.table" #> Timing stopped at: 0.001 0 0.001 cutree(temp,5) #> Error: object 'temp' not found plot(temp) #> Error: object 'temp' not found rect.hclust(temp, k=5, border=2:6) #> Error: object 'temp' not found  test_path <- c('p2','p1','d2','d1') test_weight = 0.5 cost(test_path, pdis, ptim, test_weight, data=rdata) #> Error in data.table(path = path, et = c(0), lt = c(0)): could not find function "data.table"
